meanings.definition: A fringe or tassel worn by Jewish men as a reminder of religious obligations.
meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed his zizit during the religious ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The zizit on his garment swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to play with the zizit, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The zizit dangled like a thread connecting him to his faith.
meanings.sent5: The colorful zizit added a touch of tradition to his outfit.

meanings.definition: To wear or display a zizit as a symbol of faith.
meanings.sent1: He would zizit his prayer shawl every morning before prayers.
meanings.sent2: She decided to zizit the special garment for the religious festival.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched him zizit the tassel onto his clothing.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of peace as she zizited the sacred fringe onto her robe.
meanings.sent5: The act of ziziting the tassel was a daily reminder of his beliefs.
